title: Project-Based Instructional Methods to Overcome Cognitive Barriers in Mechanical Design Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Engineering Concepts and Understanding of Elementary Education Methodologies
context.additional_context: Focus on Understanding Cognitive Barriers in Mechanical Design Learning Processes and Developing Instructional Methods to Address Them, with Education Design Considering Interdisciplinary Connections to Social Studies

learning_goals: Learners can describe four or more types of cognitive barriers encountered in the mechanical design process (e.g., lack of design vocabulary, limitations in imagination).
Learners can design three specific instructional strategies to overcome cognitive barriers through project-based learning.
Learners can analyze peer pre-service teachers' design projects via peer assessment and propose solutions to address cognitive barriers.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
